title: Area of a Rectangle
summary: Find the area of a rectangle using length and width.
whenToUse: Use for rectangular rooms, sheets, or any straight-edged surface.
howToUse: Measure length and width in the same unit.
steps: Confirm both measurements are in the same unit.
Record the area in square units.
commonMistakes: Mixing millimetres and metres without converting.
Using external dimensions when internal area is needed.
siteTips: If you're working from plans, check whether dimensions are internal or external.
Round only after multiplying to keep accuracy.
verification: Sanity-check by estimating: 3.6 × 2.4 is a bit under 9.
